author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Everett Greene, Cathy Morris bring a preview of Indy Jazz Fest to IND on First FridayTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Everett Greene, Cathy Morris bring a preview of Indy Jazz Fest to IND on First Friday
The Labor Day weekend forecast is hot but the Indianapolis International Airport (IND) is providing relief with cool jazz this Friday for guests and travelers. IND is bringing Indy events to life in Civic Plaza to help get visitors in the mood for the long holiday weekend and the September Indy Jazz Fest. The live music begins at 11:00 a.m. in Civic Plaza and includes popular Indy performers: vocalist Everett Greene and electric violinist Cathy Morris.
The music is part of IND’s “First Fridays,” a monthly series that showcases local performers
while welcoming airport guests and giving them a taste of Indiana culture.
“IND is a gateway into Central Indiana with 7 million travelers each year so we want to
introduce Indy to all visitors coming through our community’s airport,” says Angela Cain,
director of public affairs for the Indianapolis Airport Authority (IAA). “We started First
Fridays to give travelers a real “sense of place” and to feature performers and artists who
make our community special.”
The Cool City Trio featuring Laney Wilson takes the stage in the airport Civic Plaza from
11:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. Friday. A local favorite, the Cool City Trio is a frequent performer at
the Jazz Kitchen in Broad Ripple and at corporate and private parties around the city.
From 4:00 p.m. until 6:00 p.m., the Cathy Morris Trio takes over, serenading IND guests
with their perfect blend of Latin rhythms, jazz and pop. Cathy has performed for world
leaders and dignitaries and has opened for Al Jarreau, George Benson, Chuck Mangione
and many more big names. She is a frequent performer at the Formula One and Indy 500
races and at schools and events throughout central Indiana.
At 6:00 p.m., guests can unwind to the smooth sounds of jazz, blues and gospel vocalist
Everett Greene. This popular Indianapolis crooner has performed with the likes of Wes
Montgomery, Count Basie, Snooky Young and dozens of others, both locally and at places
like the Montreal Jazz Festival, the Chicago Jazz Festival and the World Music Festival in
Japan.
Source:- Indianapolis Airport
